== Relativism and absolutism ==
 
== Relativism and absolutism ==
  +
{{section-stub}}
 
{{Main|Moral relativism}}
 
{{Main|Moral relativism}}
 
{{Main|Moral absolutism}}
 
{{Main|Moral absolutism}}
−
Some thinkers hold that there is no correct definition of right behavior, that morality can only be judged with respect to the standards of a particular belief system, historical context or culture. This position is known as [[moral relativism]].<ref>http://plato.stanford.edu/entries/moral-relativism/</ref> The opposite view, that there are universal, eternal moral truths is known as [[moral absolutism]].
+
Some thinkers hold that there is no correct definition of right behavior, that morality can only be judged with respect to the standards of a particular belief system, historical context or culture. This position, known as [[moral relativism]], often cites empirical evidence from anthropology as evidence to support its claims.<ref>http://plato.stanford.edu/entries/moral-relativism/</ref>. The opposite view, that there are universal, eternal moral truths is known as [[moral absolutism]].
